department: College of Computing and Digital Media
biography: John McCash (CompTIA Sec+, GCIH, GAWN, GCFA, EnCE, GREM, SANS Lethal Forensicator) is a 24-year IT veteran. He has specialized in Security for the last 16 years, and Forensics for the last 5. He has extensive experience in digital forensics, security/system/network administration, and incident response on diverse platforms in very heterogeneous environments. He obtained his BS and MS in CS at Bradley University in 1988. John is also a semiregular contributor to the SANS Forensic Blog, and was the Technical Editor for Android Forensics by Andrew Hoog, published July 2011.
